description: Pulse Line style PMET dashboards from node_exporter

targets.legendFormat: {{instance}}

panels.description: Labeled system information as provided by the uname system call.
panels.title: System general information

targets.legendFormat: RAM Total
RAM Used
RAM Cache + Buffer
RAM Free
SWAP Used
Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache
Unused - Free memory unasigned
Swap - Swap space used
Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary
Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system
Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk
Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free
VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used
Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers
AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages
AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files
KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable
HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
Hugepagesize - Huge Page size
DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size
Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage
Pagesin - Page in operations
Pagesout - Page out operations
Pswpin - Pages swapped in
Pswpout - Pages swapped out
Pgdeactivate - Pages moved from active to inactive
Pgfree - Page free operations
Pgactivate - Pages moved from inactive to active

seriesOverrides.alias: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

targets.legendFormat: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations
Pgmajfault - Major page fault operations
Pgminfault - Minor page fault operations
Kswapd_inodesteal - Pages reclaimed via kswapd inode freeing
Pgindesteal - Pages reclaimed via inode freeing
Pageoutrun - Kswapd calls to page reclaim
Allocstall - Direct reclaim calls
Zone_reclaim_failed - Zone reclaim failures
Pgrotated - Pages rotated to tail of the LRU
Drop_pagecache - Calls to drop page cache pages
Drop_slab - Calls to drop slab cache pages
Slabs_scanned - Slab pages scanned
Unevictable_pgs_cleared - Unevictable pages cleared
Unevictable_pgs_culled - Unevictable pages culled
Unevictable_pgs_mlocked - Unevictable pages mlocked
Unevictable_pgs_munlocked - Unevictable pages munlocked
Unevictable_pgs_rescued- Unevictable pages rescued
Unevictable_pgs_scanned - Unevictable pages scanned
unevictable_pgs_stranded - Unevictable pages stranded
Pgalloc_dma - Dma mem page allocations
Pgalloc_dma32 - Dma32 mem page allocations
Pgalloc_movable - Movable mem page allocations
Pgalloc_normal - Normal mem page allocations
Pgrefill_dma - Dma mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_movable - Movable mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgrefill_normal - Normal mem pages inspected in refill_inactive_zone
Pgscan_direct_dma - Dma mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_movable - Movable mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_normal - Normal mem pages scanned
Pgscan_direct_throttle -
Pgscan_kswapd_dma - Dma mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_dma32 - Dma32 mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_movable - Movable mem pages scanned by kswapd
Pgscan_kswapd_normal - Normal mem pages scanned by kswapd
Compact_free_scanned - Pages scanned for freeing by compaction daemon
Compact_isolated - Page isolations for memory compaction
Compact_migrate_scanned - Pages scanned for migration by compaction daemon
Compact_fail - Unsuccessful compactions for high order allocations
Compact_stall - Failures to even start compacting
Compact_sucess - Successful compactions for high order allocations
Kswapd_high_wmark_hit_quickly - Times high watermark reached quickly
Kswapd_low_wmark_hit_quickly - Times low watermark reached quickly
Htlb_buddy_alloc_fail - Huge TLB page buddy allocation failures
Htlb_buddy_alloc_success - Huge TLB page buddy allocation successes
Numa_foreign - Foreign NUMA zone allocations
Numa_hit - Successful allocations from preferred NUMA zone
Numa_interleave - Interleaved NUMA allocations in each zone for each NUMA node
Numa_local - Successful allocations from local NUMA zone
Numa_miss - Unsuccessful allocations from preferred NUMA zona
Numa_other - Unsuccessful allocations from local NUMA zone
Numa_pages_migrated - NUMA page migrations
Pgmigrate_fail - Unsuccessful NUMA page migrations
Pgmigrate_success - Successful NUMA page migrations
Numa_hint_faults - NUMA hint faults trapped
Numa_hint_faults_local - Hinting faults to local nodes
Numa_pte_updates - NUMA page table entry updates
Numa_huge_pte_updates - NUMA huge page table entry updates
Thp_split - Transparent huge page splits
Workingset_activate - Page activations to form the working set
Workingset_nodereclaim - NUMA node working set page reclaims
Workingset_refault - Refaults of previously evicted pages
Thp_collapse_alloc - Transparent huge page collapse allocations
Thp_collapse_alloc_failed - Transparent huge page collapse allocation failures
Thp_zero_page_alloc - Transparent huge page zeroed page allocations
Thp_zero_page_alloc_failed - Transparent huge page zeroed page allocation failures
Thp_fault_alloc - Transparent huge page fault allocations
Thp_fault_fallback - Transparent huge page fault fallbacks
Active_anon - Active anonymous memory pages
Active_file - Active file memory memory pages
Inactive_anon - Inactive anonymous memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Inactive_file - Inactive file memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Reclaimable - Instantaneous reclaimable slab pages
Unreclaimable - Instantaneous unreclaimable slab pages
Free_pages - Free pages
Written - Pages written out in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirty - Pages in dirty state
Bounce - Bounce buffer pages
Unevictable - Unevictable pages
Mlock - Pages under mlock
Shmem - Shared memory pages
Mapped - Mapped pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Kernel_stack - Pages of kernel stack
Writeback - Writeback pages
Writeback_temp - Temporary writeback pages
File_pages - File pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirty_background_threshold - Background writeback threshold
Dirty_threshold - Dirty throttling threshold
Unstable - Pages unstable state in each zone for each NUMA node
Dirtied - Pages entering dirty state in each zone for each NUMA node
Page_table_pages - Page table pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Alloc_batch - Pages allocated to other zones due to insufficient memory for each zone for each NUMA node
Isolated_anon - Isolated anonymous memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Isolated_file - Isolated file memory pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Anon_pages - Anonymous mapped pagecache pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Anon_transparent_hugepages - Anonymous transparent huge pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Free_cma - Free Contiguous Memory Allocator pages in each zone for each NUMA node
Vmscan_write - Pages written by VM scanner from LRU
Immediate_reclaim - Prioritise for reclaim when writeback ends in each zone for each NUMA node

title: pl-node-memory
